page.title: 12Binley Fire Service
page.content: Binley Fire Station was built in 1969. It began as part of the Coventry Brigade ,but was taken over by the West Midlands in 1974. At the present time there is one fire engine, a Dennis R5, a rescue ladder, and a hydraulic platform. Modern fire engines are propelled by deisel fuel and on average use 15 litres per day. There are 28 firemen stationed at Binley, working two shifts from 9.0- 18.00hrs. and 18.00-9.00hrs. Six firemen turn out on a call. They sleep on site and their rest room has a T.V. and Video. The only female workers on site are the cook and the two cleaners. Three to four people are killed in local fires every year.
